intro: Stenosiphonium, commonly known as the narrow-siphon plant, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. The leaves are usually narrow and elongated, with a slightly hairy texture. Native to regions of southern Africa, Stenosiphonium species are often found in rocky or sandy soils. These plants are not widely cultivated but are of interest to botanists due to their unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
